content.text:
# Draft:Edward S. Silvera

Edward S. Silvera was born in the year 1906 in Florida to Edward Silvera Sr. and Lulu Silvera (Green). Silvera’s family moved to Orange, Essex, New Jersey when he was very young, and he grew up there in the 1910s and 1920s
Silvera attended Lincoln University alongside fellow writers William Waring Cuney and Langston Hughes. Much of Silvera’s work was published in the Messenger magazine, the Crisis magazine, Opportunity magazine, Countee Cullen’s anthology Caroling Dusk, Black Opals magazine, Charles S. Johnson’s Ebony And Topaz, and included in the collection Four Lincoln University Poets, along with William Allyn Hill, William Waring Cuney, and Langston Hughes.
Edward S. Silvera died unexpectedly in 1937, at the age of 31. The cause is unknown.
